snippet: A huge black locust damaged power lines, leaving 99 percent of Greenwich, Conn., without electricity and disrupting train service.
abstract: Fall of an 85-foot black locust tree in Greenwich, Conn, following a windstorm that swept up the coast; damages power lines, leaving about 30,000 residents without electricity and disrupting train service between New York City and New England.
lead_paragraph: A huge black locust damaged power lines, leaving 99 percent of Greenwich, Conn., without electricity and disrupting train service.

headline.seo: Single Tree Kills Power in Greenwich
headline.main: A Tree Falls, Twice, Killing All the Power to Greenwich
headline.print_headline: A Tree Falls, Twice, Killing All the Power to Greenwich
